  • Method Details

    • openMostRecentlyDownloadedFileAsCsv

      @When("^I find and open the last downloaded (?:CSV|csv) file with (\\d+) header rows?$") public static void openMostRecentlyDownloadedFileAsCsv(int numberOfHeaderRows) throws FileNotFoundException
      Sets the most recently-downloaded file to be the current file-under-test with the given number of header rows.
      Gherkin Examples:
      • I open the last downloaded CSV file with 3 header rows
      • I open the last downloaded csv file with 1 header row
      Parameters:
      numberOfHeaderRows - int the number of header rows in the CSV file to test. Number of header rows must be declared in order to properly process the file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - In the case that the file is not found in the location that the DownloadManager specifies.

    • openSpecificFileAsCsv

      @When("^I open (.*) as a (?:CSV|csv) file with (\\d+) header rows?$") public static void openSpecificFileAsCsv(String fileLocation, int numberOfHeaderRows) throws FileNotFoundException
      Sets the given file to be the current file-under-test with the given number of header rows.
      Gherkin Examples:
      • I open test file with 1 header as a CSV file with 1 header row
      • I open src/test/resources/csv/test_0header.csv as a CSV file with 0 header rows
      Parameters:
      fileLocation - String either the location of the file, given by a path, or the name of a testdata object in the current page object.
      numberOfHeaderRows - int the number of header rows in the CSV file to test. Number of header rows must be declared in order to properly process the file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - In the case that the file is not found in the location specified.

    • setAllColumnValuesInCsvFile

      @When("^I set all values in the (.*) column to (.*) in the (?:CSV|csv) file$") public static void setAllColumnValuesInCsvFile(String column, String desiredValue)
      Edits the current CSV file, setting every cell in the given column to the given value.
      Gherkin Example:
      • I set all values in the Name column to Sunny in the CSV file
      Parameters:
      column - String column the name of the column, or an ordinal (1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).
      desiredValue - String the value to set each cell to.

    • setRowColumnValuesInCsvFile

      @When("^I set the value in the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row of the (.*) column to (.*) in the (?:CSV|csv) file$") public static void setRowColumnValuesInCsvFile(String row, String column, String desiredValue)
      Edits the current CSV file, setting the cell in a given column and row to the given value.
      Gherkin Example:
      • I set the value in the last row of the Name column to Sunny in the CSV file
      • I set the value in the 1st row of the Name column to Sunny in the CSV file
      Parameters:
      row - String the ordinal of the row to modify (last, 1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).
      column - String the name of the column to modify, or an ordinal (1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).
      desiredValue - String the value to set the cell to.

    • deleteCsvRow

      @When("^I delete the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row entry in the (?:CSV|csv) file$") public static void deleteCsvRow(String row)
      Edits the current CSV file and completely removes the given row.
      Gherkin Example:
      • I delete the last row entry in the CSV file
      • I delete the 2nd row entry in the CSV file
      Parameters:
      row - String the ordinal of the row to delete (last, 1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).

    • verifyCsvCellHasValue

      @Then("^I verify the (?:CSV|csv) file( do(?:es)? not)? (has|have|contains?) the value (.*) in the (.*) column and the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row$") public static void verifyCsvCellHasValue(String assertion, String matchType, String textToMatch, String column, String rowNum)
      Verifies the current CSV file has or does not have the given text in the given column and given row.
      Gherkin Examples:
      • I verify the csv file has the value Sonny in the Name column and the 3rd row
      • I verify the CSV file does not contain the value Liston in the Surname column and the last row
      Parameters:
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the cell.
      column - String column the name of the column, or an ordinal (1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).
      rowNum - String the row number. Can be "la" to specify the last row, or an integer.

    • verifyCsvAllColumnCellsHaveValue

      @Then("^I verify( not)? all cells in the the (.*) column (?:of|in) the (?:CSV|csv) file (has|have|contains?) the value (.*)$") public static void verifyCsvAllColumnCellsHaveValue(String assertion, String column, String matchType, String textToMatch)
      Verifies all / not all cells in the given column of the current CSV file have / contain the given text value.
      Gherkin Examples:
      • I verify all cells in the Name column in the csv file have the value Sonny
      • I verify not all cells in the Surname column in the csv file contain the value List
      Parameters:
      column - String column the name of the column, or an ordinal (1st, 2nd, 25th, etc.).
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for all cells to have/contain the value. If " not", looks for at least one cell to NOT have/contain the value.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the cell.

    • verifyCsvAllColumnCellsAreEmpty

      @Then("^I verify all cells are (not )?empty in the (.*) column (?:of|in) the (?:CSV|csv) file$") public static void verifyCsvAllColumnCellsAreEmpty(String assertion, String column)
      Verifies all cells in the csv column are or are not empty. If checking that all column cells are empty, this method will assert that every cell is empty. If checking that all column cells are not empty, this method will assert that every cell is NOT empty (all cells have at least some content).

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify all cells are empty in the Zip Code column in the csv file
      • I verify all cells are not empty in the Name column of the CSV file
      Parameters:
      assertion - String if null, checks that all cells are empty. Otherwise, checks that all cells are not empty.
      column - String name of the column in the csv, or an ordinal column index (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.)

    • verifyCsvColumnExists

      public static void verifyCsvColumnExists(String assertion, String matchType, String columnName)
      Verifies the given table contains or exactly matches or does not contain or does not exactly match the given column

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the csv contains the Phone Number column
      • I verify the CSV does not contain a Deductible column
      Parameters:
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      columnName - String name of the column to verify

    • verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column of the (?:csv|CSV)( do(?:es)? not)? (has|have|contains?) the same text (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*)$") public static void verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn(String column, String assertion, String matchType, String key)
      Verifies a csv column does or does not contain text for the stored value.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column of the csv contains the same text entered for the username
      • I verify the Contact column of the csv contains the same text used for the phone number field
      • I verify the Airport Code column of the CSV contains the same text selected for the airport's code RDU
      • I verify the Airport Code column of the CSV does not contain the same text selected for the airport's code RDU
      Parameters:
      column - String Name of the column to verify
      assertion - String Assertion dictating if we are checking if the column does contain or does not contain
      key - String the key to retrieve the text to match from the configuration manager

    • verifyTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column of the (?:csv|CSV)( do(?:es)? not)? (has|have|contains?) the text (.*)$") public static void verifyTextAppearsInColumn(String column, String assertion, String matchType, String textToMatch)
      Verifies a csv column does or does not contain text. Can be partial or exact match.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column of the csv contains the text Sam
      • I verify the Timezone column of the csv has the text EST
      • I verify the Airport Code column of the CSV does not contain the text RDU
      • I verify the Airport Code column of the CSV does not have the text RDU
      Parameters:
      column - String Name of the column to verify
      assertion - String Assertion dictating if we are checking if the column does contain or does not contain
      textToMatch - String the key to retrieve the text to match from the configuration manager

    • verifyNumberOfRows

      @Then("^I verify the (?:CSV|csv) has (\\d+) data rows?") public static void verifyNumberOfRows(int numRows)
      Verifies the CSV has the given number of rows of data, not including the header rows.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the csv has 1 data row
      • I verify the CSV has 22 data rows
      Parameters:
      numRows - int the number of rows to verify against.
